body.name: Babyletto Gelato 4-in-1 Convertible Crib with Toddler Bed Conversion in Washed Natural and White, Greenguard Gold Certified
features: PLAYFUL PERSONALITY: Scandi-inspired design with rounded posts, spindles, and customizable feet. The low profile and 4 adjustable mattress positions help with a growing babe. Complete your look with the Gelato 3-drawer dresser

GREENGUARD GOLD CERTIFIED: The Gelato has undergone rigorous scientific testing for over 10,000 chemical emissions and VOCs. It contributes to cleaner indoor air, creating a healthier environment for your baby to sleep, play, and grow

4-IN-1 CONVERTIBILITY: The Gelato transitions from crib to toddler bed and daybed, with an included toddler bed conversion kit. And converts to a full-sized bed with an additional conversion kit, sold separately (No.M5789)
SAFE FOR BABE: We go the extra step to ensure your babe's safety. Finished in a non-toxic multi-step painting and staining process that is lead and phthalate safe

SUSTAINABLE DESIGN: Made with sustainably sourced solid New Zealand pine wood, one of the most renewable woods available. Our hidden hardware ensures a clean look with no visible screws or bolts seen on the furniture exterior
body.description: The Gelato 4-in-1 Convertible Crib is a must-have with stylish mamas and papas for a reason! It's practical and playful with customizable colored feet, an included toddler bed conversion kit, and the option to add a full-sized bed conversion kit.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Gelato 3-Drawer Changer Dresser Pure Core Crib Mattress Gelato Feet Set Kiwi Glider Recliner w/ Electronic Control and USB Hidden Hardware Twin/Full Size Bed Conversion Kit Shown In Washed Natural / White - Mint Performance Cream Eco-Weave Washed Natural

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Purchased two of these for my two grandsons
reviews.reviewText: As gifts to my son and his wife, I was excited to be able to purchase the nursery furniture. They picked this crib out for their first son, and loved it so much that they wanted another for their second son. Very easy to assemble, sturdy, and a nice simple look. Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for our nursery
reviews.reviewText: Easy to assemble, sturdy and looks really nice!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We are expecting and absolutely love this crib! It was easy to put together for the boys. It also grows with the baby as they grow. We can’t wait to use it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Crib skirts work and it has a standard (safe) design
reviews.reviewText: UPDATE, 1.5 years laterCrib still looks great and I actually just noticed a few parts where my son had chewed the crib. The light color of the wood actually hides chewed spots very well, which is great!! (My older daughter had a white crib and the chewed parts were very noticeable and stark)I think all of the negative reviews (minus an occasional quality issue), must be from first time parents, or complainers.The design is pretty much identical to a different Da Vinci brand crib we have as well. This one though has much nicer looking wood and feels sturdier too. I have no safety concerns whatsoever.I love that it came with the toddler rail. (The one for our Da Vinci crib was an extra $80 on top of the crib price)A crib skirt will work just fine, providing it has a slit in each corner. Ours were from pottery barn kids and worked. Just be aware it will work best when the mattress is at its highest (for a newborn) and there is the most room for a crib skirt to hang below it. Once you start lowering the mattress it won't look very good because you will only have a couple of inches for it to hang before it just lays on the floor.Delivery and packaging were fine too. Set up was ok, not super fast, but it all went together properly. Overall I would recommend this crib.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful crib, but hard to put together.
reviews.reviewText: It was quite hard to assemble! Took me an hour and a half to put together. The support that the mattress goes on was super hard to get attached. Ended up scratching part of the crib trying to get it in. It was almost like one of the holes didn't align correctly because 3 of the screws went in really easy, and one was super hard.The pieces aren't labeled well and I ended up having to take pieces apart twice, to put them together again because I put the pieces together the wrong way. I feel like it could be labeled better. Also, I wish where the screws went in weren't as visible. I've put together a lot of furniture in my time on this earth, and this is probably one of the most confusing things I've put together.Putting it together was hard, but the crib is beautiful, and I love the design, but I'm dreading the day I have to lower the mattress. Hopefully that won't be as hard.The crib seems very sturdy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very easy assembly, great quality!!
reviews.reviewText: Just finished setting our crib up, and I love it so far! Very easy assembly. I did it myself at 26wks pregnant in about 30 min. I love that it’s solid wood, and specifically appreciate that the light stain on the wood has been tested to be safe. I spent a lot of time researching and reading reviews on other cribs and brands that had issues with paint smells and harmful chemicals, and was happy to spend a little more money on this crib, knowing it will be safe for our babe. As far as the color of the “natural” color, I don’t see a pink hue to it, as other reviewers have mentioned. You can see the natural color of the wood underneath the stain that is a very light wood with some greys to it, and the stain creates more of a white wash finish, but is still a natural beige. I love the color!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2020
reviews.reviewText: COMPLETELY IN LOVE WITH THIS CRIB!! It is so beautiful, pictures honestly do not do it justice! If you are looking for minimalistic - search no further! The color of wood is very light in person, imo a smidge lighter than the pictures. But that was cool with me. I think it’s perfect. Love that is has circular pegs instead of traditional squared ones (for safety reasons). It is completely level at the top which is also a bonus safety feature. My only gripe - and I’m nit-picking here - is the directions. No words, just diagrams lol. If you’re a visual learner that’s probably okay for you. But I struggled a bit and ended up putting the end pieces on backwards and had to disassemble, and reassemble - even with looking at the directions thoroughly beforehand and thinking I had matched the pictures correctly. 🤷‍♀️ It didn’t bother me too much, my husband helped when I got stuck. Definitely a two person assembly. But other than vague directions - the crib is flipping beautiful!! Wish I could explain how perfect it is. Incredibly smooth, light neutral wood tone with white legs will complete any nursery theme you’ve picked out. Seriously. Love love love! Couldn’t love it more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful, but not worth the price
reviews.reviewText: I love the look of this crib. It reminds me of the IKEA crib, but a little more high end. I got it full price, but wish I got it on sale. It’s a nice crib and what I wanted, but definitely a little too expensive for what it is.
Nos gusto mucho la cuna. El color es bonito. No pesa mucho, lo que hace fácil de mover cuando se necesita.
